      • getSameOperation

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation getSameOperation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation op,
                                                              org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class owner)
        Search an identical operation within a class. This function is useful to identify (and synchronize) operations.
        Parameters:
        op - The operation that should be compared.
        owner -
        Returns:

      • isSameOperation

        public static boolean isSameOperation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation op1,
                                      org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation op2)
        Returns true, if two operations are identical. An operation is considered identical, if the operation name as well as all parameter names and types are equal. Type equality is checked via names only, to avoid that identical types within a source and a copy model would yield false.
        Parameters:
        op1 - first operation
        op2 - second operation
        Returns:
        true, if operations are identical

      • isOperationStereotypeApplied

        public static boolean isOperationStereotypeApplied(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier cl,
                                                   Class<? extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> stereotype)
        Check whether a certain stereotype is applied to an arbitrary operation of a classifier. This is for instance useful to verify whether a class has a constructor or destructor
        Parameters:
        cl - A classifier to verify
        stereotype - The stereotype that may be applied to one of its operations
        Returns:
        true, if the passed stereotype is applied to one of the operations

      • isSameOperation

        public static boolean isSameOperation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation op1,
                                      org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation op2,
                                      boolean checkName)
        Returns true, if two operations are identical with optional name check. An operation is considered identical, if the operation name (optional) as well as all parameter names and types are equal. Type equality is checked via names only, to avoid that identical types within a source and a copy model would yield false.
        Parameters:
        op1 - first operation
        op2 - second operation
        checkName - if true, require that operation names are identical
        Returns:
        true, if operations are identical

      • syncOperation

        public static void syncOperation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation sourceOp,
                                 org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation targetOp)
        synchronize source and target operation (remove all parameters, copy afterwards)
        Parameters:
        sourceOp - the source operation
        targetOp - the target operation
        newRoot - a new root package (e.g. another model). Ensure that types referenced by the parameter exist within this root package (copy, if not). Null indicates that no copying should be done.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • parametersOutInout

        public static org.eclipse.emf.common.util.EList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Parameter> parametersOutInout(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Operation operation)
        Parameters:
        operation - an operation
        Returns:
        all out, inout and return parameters of the passed operation

      • paramName

        public static String paramName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Parameter parameter)
        Return the name of a parameter with a specific handling of return parameters: Always return the name "retValue" in case of the latter. This is quite useful for marshalling operations (which need to assign a value to the return parameter, which is sometimes not initialized)
        Parameters:
        parameter - a UML parameter
        Returns:
        the parameter name or retValue in case of a return parameter
